intro: Pedicularis siamensis, commonly known as the Siam lousewort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
